profileText: A Delegate from the Territory of Utah; born in the parish of Kirk Patrick, Isle of Man, January 8, 1829; attended the common schools in Douglas, Isle of Man; immigrated to the United States in 1846 and lived in New York City until 1848, when he went to St. Louis; settled in the Territory of Utah in 1852 and taught school; served as secretary of the Territorial council during the sessions of 1856, 1857, 1859, and 1860; one of the founders of the Salt Lake Herald in 1870, serving as managing editor and president; delegate to the constitutional conventions in 1872 and 1882; member of the Territorial council in 1874, 1876, 1880, and 1882; recorder of Salt Lake City in 1876, 1878, 1880, and 1882; elected as a Democrat to the Forty-seventh Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the action of the House declaring the Delegate-elect ineligible; reelected as a Democrat to the Forty-eighth, Forty-ninth, and Fiftieth Congresses and on the People's Party ticket to the Fifty-first and Fifty-second Congresses and served from November 7, 1882, to March 3, 1893; was not a candidate for renomination in 1892; was an unsuccessful Democratic candidate for Governor of Utah in 1895; member of the State senate in 1896; resumed the management of the Salt Lake Herald; died in Salt Lake City, Utah, September 20, 1911; interment in Salt Lake City Cemetery.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Haslam, Larry. "Utah's Delegates to Congress, 1851-1896." masters' thesis, Utah State University, 1962.

researchRecord.name: 1849-1916, 76 items.
researchRecord.description: Includes typescript of John Thomas Caine's journal for April 1854-October 1856, which records his missionary activities in Hawaii; also certificates, invitations, and programs relative to his church and political activities, his involvement with the Salt Lake Theatre, Deseret University, and the Deseret Agricultural and Manufacturing Society. Also includes his commission in Nauvoo Legion. Many of the certificates are signed by Brigham Young.

researchRecord.name: 1848, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A journal of John Thomas Caine from 1848. Includes record of members of the branch, notations made of church meetings and remarks of church leaders, and list of subscriptions for traveling missionaries. Continues with his entries relative to his travels from New York on his way to St. Louis.
